rComments: AVOID HER!! she is not helpful, not approachable nor likable. She does not curve, your grade only comes from  midterm and final. Has a mean attitude towards students.
This class can be difficult if you can't problem solve.  Her tests are exactly what she taught, no trick questions or unseen material.

Doesn't mess around. If you should have known the answer to your question from the reading or the lecture, she'll tell you that you should already know that. Keep up with the reading and the homework, study to comprehension, and go to some office hours, and you'll get an A from her. Really enjoyable professor -- very funny and colloquial.

I was afraid to take this class but its very doable, I got a solid B. HW, not turned it but do not fall behind. Two tests, midterm is 40% and final is 60%. Final is cumulative. Not really a curve. Hard tests but very fair, they could have been worse. I definitely learned a lot in this class.

Your grade in Needhi's class is unfortunately comprised of only 2 exams. Therefore, there is little room for error. However, Needhi is always willing to help and gives plenty of resources to the students to help prepare for the exams. If you put the time in, you should do at least reasonably well. The exams are fair to slightly difficult.
She's not clear at all. Her exams are tough. Doesnt Curve. Avoid her class!    professor sucks...

This class is completely doable. If you don't understand the material, ask (do this early on in the class). She does not trick you at all! The homework is way harder than the tests. I studied a few hours before the midterm and half a day before the final and got an A-. So if you put in the effort to understand all the material, you will get an A.

Lectures are accompanied with relevant worksheets that she goes over in class. Recommended homework problems are a huge help. Exams are based onsimilar to the worksheets and homework problems. Emphasis on problem solving. Excellent lectures and overall an enjoyable professor.
Very difficult.

Needhi is SO AWESOME!! Exams were based off of her lectures and the worksheets we did in class. Midterm was worth 40% of the overall grade, final was worth 60%. If you're good at problem solving, you should do exceptionally in her class. If you're better at memorizing facts, however, you'll probably have more trouble. The course was webcast.

I want to blame her for not doing too well, but ultimately it was my fault. Yes, she's intimidating, but she's not your mom. Her whole class was webcast so I had no excuse not to do better. It's my fault I slacked off at the end. Beware, this class gets really difficult after the midterm. Don't put it off just because you did well on the midterm.

Needhi is the best! She's very clear and helpful in office hours! The average on midterm one was 78% I believe; however I don't know about the final. She tests you on her lectures and worksheets. I didn't really feel that the book was necessary or that great. If you go to class, and utilize the resources i.e MIS, webcast, and TAs you'll do great!

Honestly, she is one of the best professors I have had at UCSC. She makes even the most complicated concepts easy to understand and her worksheets are super helpful. Admits when she makes a mistake which you dont often see from profs. Also funny. Makes this class super enjoyable. If you keep up with the lectures and do the HWs you'll be golden.

Dr. Bhalla is awesome. She's very approachable, funny in lectures, and is very attentive to her students' understanding of the material. It's a lot of work, but if you keep up with it, it's a fairly easy class. The tests are predictable based on the practice tests she provides. The TA I have is also THE BEST EVER. She makes us extra worksheets.
Needhi is the coolest prof ever. While the material itself is slightly difficult, if you take advantage of office hours you should be fine.

The class was super easy. As long as you go to class and section, you are golden. I sort of used the textbook but I mostly went off her slides. GREAT teacher. I had a very helpful and sexy looking TA so that helped haha anyways, just study and go to class+section.
I struggled very much with this course and went to her office hours for help. She was unable to suggest any other resources for additional help. She is very confusing and the course is very hard.

Tough class since the level of difficulty increases very rapidly. She speeds through the material, and is almost robotic in her delivery, but very clear, organized, and patient. Not very approachable, even slightly intimidating. Tests can be misleading, but are a good reflection of the material. You need to have it down to the specifics to do well.
She is a great Genetics teacher. The concepts are tough but you have her slides, worksheets, practice homework, and past exams. It is very doable to get an A.

Very king professor, but her lectures can be a little boring. The material is almost completely redundant from the book, leaving the class almost entirely lacking flare. Her exams can be tricky, but no unreasonable. There are also clicker questions in class, so attendance is mandatory if you  want a high grade.

Overall a good professor.  Genetics is a difficult subject and she expects a lot out of her students.  She uses clicker questions during class which accounts for part of your grade.  Tests are tough, but not unfair.  Doesn't curve much at all.  You have to do the hw, read the book before class and review her slides to do well.

The worksheets and slides are good. She tends to over explain answers to questions, gets a little frustrated, and leaves everyone confused. She's kind of intimidating and not the most approachable.  The tests aren't bad once you can interpret through all the nomenclature she expects you to know . Form study groups and find a good TA!

Her worksheets and slides are good, but once people start asking questions she over explains the answers and leaves everyone confused. She's kind of intimidating and not the most approachable. The tests weren't that bad once you got past all the nomenclature she expected you to know. Find groups to study with.

Nice prof. Lectures are mostly clear and she's willing to answer questions in lecture or office hours. Both lectures and book are necessary, but tests mostly on her lectures. Tests are manageable if you actually study, and she gives practice sets/tests. The other page is wrong too; her name is "Needhi".
Great professor! Its a tough class and requires lots of practice but she made it as easy as can be!
